item.description:
After a long hiatus, our next doggie hike:

Gay City State Park in Hebron.

 

Given the sizable turnout, we will be starting the hike no later than 10:05 am.


This extensive trail system is maintained in cooperation with the Connecticut Forest and Park Association, and is a great place to hike with our dogs.

It is located on Rt85 by the intersection of Daly Rd. Coordinates: 41.72611,-72.44056 (Gay City State Park)

 

HwD Operating Principles - please click to read.

 

Link for directions

http://maps.google.com/maps?saddr=&daddr=41.72611%2C-72.44056+%28Gay+City+State+Park%29&hl=en

 

Directions per the DEP website:

From the South/New London area: Follow Route 85 north. Park entrance is 6.7 miles past the intersection with Route 66.

From Glastonbury area: Take Route 85. Park entrance is 2.0 miles past the intersection with Route 94.

From the North/Hartford & Massachusetts area: I-384 east to Exit 5. Take Route 85 south for 4.7 miles.

 

Trail Map:

http://www.ct.gov/dep/lib/dep/stateparks/maps/gaycity.pdf


RU Lost? Call/SMS Fred at 860-227-4027
item.how_to_find_us: Fred will be there in his Royal Bleu Oriental Gas-Powered Rickshaw.
item.name: Gay City State Park
